jobs.title: Customer Happiness Manager - Remote South East Asia
jobs.descriptionHtml:
South East Asia-based candidates only

About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Job Description

Your role is to offer support to authors, creative publishing professionals (editors, designers, marketers, publicists, ghostwriters, translators, etc.), and optimize conversion.

You will be part of a team of 8. Your role will involve:

  • Offering support to Reedsy users;

  • Reviewing projects submitted on the platform;

  • Building customer funnels (design emails and in-app messages) to reactivate users and introduce Reedsy's features to them;

  • Maintaining and update our FAQ based on user feedback and questions;

  • Suggesting product features based on user feedback; and

  • Contributing to maintaining a high NPS (currently at 86!).

Requirements

  • 5+ years of customer support experience (Intercom, Crisp, Zendesk, etc.)

  • Experience automating support processes

  • Great understanding of on-boarding and conversion rate optimization (CRO) techniques

  • Entrepreneurial minded

  • Strong writing skills, you can write clearly and accurately, with perfect grammar and spelling

  • Native-level English speaker

  • Availability to work every other weekend.

Bonus Points

  • Previous experience working for a marketplace and/or in a creative industry

  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds.

  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor

Benefits

  • Work from home;

  • Paid paternal and maternal leave;

  • Annual team retreat

Salary range:

$25k – $45k

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Manager (Studio) - Remote
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Responsibilities

We’ve built an app called Studio that allows writers to develop their worlds and characters, improve their craft, and share their story with the world as a print or digital book. It’s unique and already used by tens of thousands each day. Your role is to grow the number of monthly active users into the millions, and turn Studio into the most essential app for authors. You’ll tap into new audiences, convert existing Reedsy users to Studio, and spread the word about why Studio is the best tool out there for writing and editing books.

You will:

  • Define objectives for growth with Reedsy’s management;

  • Leverage Reedsy’s existing ecosystem by implementing referral campaigns and driving user advocacy;

  • Grow our top of funnel through a network of affiliates and influencers, as well as partnerships with brands and publications;

  • Work with our content team to create engaging content for social media and organize events;

  • Tap into new audiences and try unproven community growth strategies.

Requirements

This role is for a creative and analytical marketer with significant experience in building communities. Here’s what we look for:

  • 5+ years of proven experience in growth or product marketing at a fast-paced startup;

  • Knowledge of the craft of writing through personal experience or studies;

  • Experience writing branded content (social and emails);

  • Experience in mobile video creation and editing; and

  • Strong ability to collect, analyze and report on performance data.

Bonus points

  • You’ve developed your own creative project (a book, a blog, a product — anything!);

  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds; and

  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor.

Benefits

  • Work from home;

  • Paid paternal and maternal leave;

  • Annual team retreat

Salary range:

€40k – €60k

jobs.title: Learning Course Instructor (part-time) - Remote
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Responsibilities

Reedsy Learning is our online publishing school, with over 50 courses and over 200,000 students to date. More recently, we introduced How to Write a Novel, a masterclass to help authors complete their novel in just 3 months. We’re looking for a course instructor to host weekly webinars with guest authors, and to support students throughout the course by answering questions and offering guidance.

You will:

  • Host weekly live webinars for creative writing students and members of the Reedsy community, including: author interviews, deep dives on writing topics, and live editing sessions;

  • Find and book guest speakers to interview for webinars;

  • Answer messages from students and/or host weekly office hours; and

  • Create short marketing videos to help promote the course and our community membership.

Requirements

  • Experience teaching creative writing and/or publishing courses at an MA level

  • Worked with bestselling authors at a top publishing house

  • Existing network of published authors and publishing professionals

  • Available to work part-time (15-20 hours/week)

  • Based in the US

Bonus points:

  • Being an active writer, developing your profile as a recognised literary voice;

  • Experience in content creation, especially video production and editing;

  • Experience in online course creation or management;

  • Experience in community management;

  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds;

  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor.

Benefits

  • Work from home

Salary range:

$30k - $60k

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Job Description

Your role is to grow Reedsy's supply of creative publishing professionals (editors, designers, marketers, publicists, ghostwriters, translators, etc.), build relationships and optimize conversion.

You will:

  • Contribute to designing and implementing scalable lead acquisition ideas;

  • Reach out to top creative professionals and present Reedsy to them;

  • Optimize the balance between supply and demand by crunching data and following KPIs;

  • Build customer funnels (design emails and in-app messages) to reactivate and educate users;

  • Organize webinars and create content to engage with our community; and

  • Liaise with our Data Analyst to report on supply growth and create dashboards.

Requirements

This role is for a technical marketer who wants to execute on their own ideas. Here's what we look for:

  • At least 3 years of experience in scaling acquisition for a startup, across both paid and non-paid channels;

  • Familiar with AB testing and conversion optimization;

  • Ability to analyze performance data (using tools such as Google Analytics, Sheets or Data Studio) and use it to inform your decisions;

  • Experience running webinars and online events;

  • Entrepreneurial mindset; and

  • Strong writing skills and native-level English speaker

Bonus Points

  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds;

  • A good dose of ambition, as well as a great sense of humor.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
We welcome applicants based anywhere in Europe.

About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Responsibilities

As a Quality Assurance Engineer at Reedsy, you will work closely with our development and product teams to make sure our software meets high-quality standards.

  • Manually test across different platforms and devices and validate new features;

  • Flag visual elements or functionality that could be improved;

  • Contribute to creating a consistent user experience across our apps;

  • Perform regression testing on existing features;

  • Write and maintain automated end-to-end testing; and

  • Triage user-reported bugs: capturing reproduction steps; writing failing tests; and communicating these issues with the development team.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience writing and maintaining automated tests as well as manually testing software

  • A good understanding of UI/UX design

  • Good, critical eye for detail

  • Perfectly fluent in English

  • Enjoy working remotely

Bonus points:

  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor

  • Work from home;

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Job Description

Your role is to offer support to authors, creative publishing professionals (editors, designers, marketers, publicists, ghostwriters, translators, etc.), and optimize conversion.

You will be part of a team of 8. Your role will involve:

  • Offering support to Reedsy users;

  • Reviewing projects submitted on the platform;

  • Building customer funnels (design emails and in-app messages) to reactivate users and introduce Reedsy's features to them;

  • Maintaining and update our FAQ based on user feedback and questions;

  • Suggesting product features based on user feedback; and

  • Contributing to maintaining a high NPS (currently at 86!).

Requirements

  • Analytical mind

  • You can work as part of a team (a remote team so the ability to communicate is even more essential), but also show initiative and take responsibility for your tasks

  • Strong writing skills, you can write clearly and accurately, with perfect grammar and spelling

  • Native-level English speaker

  • Availability to work every other weekend and full-time for 6 months

  • Customer support experience is welcomed, but not a necessity

Bonus Points

  • Previous experience working/interest in a marketplace and/or in a creative industry;

  • A good dose of ambition, as well as a great sense of humour;

  • Fluent in French, Spanish, or German.

Benefits

  • Work from home;

  • Paid paternal and maternal leave;

  • Annual team retreat

Salary range:

£14k – £26k

jobs.title: AI Engineer - Remote Europe
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 5,000,000 authors, and transformed the way people write and publish their book. Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Responsibilities

At Reedsy, our goal is to build the best ecosystem for writers, supporting them at every stage of their creative journey. Over the years, we've developed a suite of products, including a marketplace, book discovery platform, writing app, central authentication system, and email marketing tools.

As a publishing startup, we're thoughtful about how we integrate AI. As an AI Engineer, you'll help us empower authors to do more — enhancing creativity, not replacing it. You’ll focus on building intelligent features that support storytelling and streamline workflows.

In this role, you will:

  • Design and implement AI-powered tools for authors (e.g. a narrative co-pilot, visual storyboarding assistant, etc.);

  • Improve internal workflows by automating repetitive tasks and enhancing UX across our products;

  • Build internal tools for AI development, including evaluation benchmarks and automated testing;

  • Collaborate closely with engineers and operations teams to identify high-impact AI opportunities.

Requirements

  • Proven experience integrating AI/ML into real-world products, with ownership of the full lifecycle — from modeling and evaluation to deployment and go-to-market execution.

  • Experience working with large language models (e.g., prompt engineering, fine-tuning, model selection, retrieval-augmented generation)

  • Familiarity with orchestration tools (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, or custom chaining frameworks)

  • Knowledge of hallucination detection and mitigation strategies

  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (preferably Google Cloud Platform) and scalable AI deployment

  • Familiarity with embeddings, vector databases, and Elasticsearch

  • Experience with AI developer tooling (e.g., Cursor, intelligent CI/CD, AI-powered QA)

Bonus Points

  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds.

  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor

Benefits

  • Work from home

  • Paid paternal and maternal leave

  • Annual team retreat

Salary range:

70k-120k EUR - 0-0.2% equity

  • Familiarity with the publishing industry and writing craft concepts;

  • Experience with email marketing, conversion optimization and A/B testing;
